abstract: Ask the critics about cast changes, "The X Factor" and anything else in the television universe.
snippet: Ask the critics about cast changes, "The X Factor" and anything else in the television universe.
lead_paragraph: This week, the critic Mike Hale took a look at a spate of major cast changes in prime time and came up with a report card on how the shows -- "Two and a Half Men," "CSI," "The Office," "Law & Order: SVU" and "House" -- are handling the new characters. Only "CSI" got an A, while "Two and a Half Men" received a cringe-worthy D. But the critic Neil Genzlinger says he actually enjoys the Ashton Kutcher version of "Men." How would you grade the shifts? Then there's "The X Factor," which is doing well with the 18-to-49 demographic but not with Mr. Genzlinger, who has some issues. Is there any "reality" in that reality competition or is Simon Cowell orchestrating everything? And what to make of the American Academy of Pediatrics warning, yet again, that parents should limit the amount of time infants and toddlers spend in front of the television screen? Are you suffering the effects of too much TV watching as a baby? You asked and the critics answered your questions:
